meanings.definition: To shape or mold something into a different form or appearance.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys transshaping clay into various sculptures.
meanings.sent2: The artist spent hours transshaping the lump of clay into a beautiful vase.
meanings.sent3: The magician transshaped a simple balloon into a complex animal shape.
meanings.sent4: His words had the power to transshape her mood from sad to joyful.
meanings.sent5: The caterpillar transshaped into a stunning butterfly, mesmerizing everyone.

meanings.definition: The act of transforming or changing the shape of something.
meanings.sent1: The transshaping of the landscape was evident after the storm.
meanings.sent2: The transshaping of the dough into bread was a skillful process.
meanings.sent3: The transshaping of the clouds by the wind created interesting shapes in the sky.
meanings.sent4: The transshaping of the city skyline with new buildings was impressive.
meanings.sent5: The transshaping of the caterpillar into a butterfly was a beautiful transformation.
